New Records: Anthony Volpe hit the ninth World Series grand slam in Yankees history -- seven more than any other team and the sixth MLB-wide this postseason
Freddie Freeman has now homered in six consecutive World Series games, dating back to 2021 with the Braves, the longest streak in the Fall Classic
Freddie Freeman has 10 RBIs this series, passing Gil Hodges (1956) and Duke Snider (1952) for most RBIs in a World Series in Dodgers history (RBI official since 1920)
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe delivered the ninth World Series grand slam in Yankees history
Austin Wells homered as a rookie catcher in the sixth inning
Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in Game 1
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees are the first team to force a Game 5 when down 3-0 in a World Series since the Reds in 1970 against the Orioles
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the fifth World Series game with homers from multiple catchers
11 runs were the Yankees' most in a World Series game since 1978 Game 5 (12)
